p: FAD catalyzes the formation of a double bond at a specific position in a fatty acid chain to produce an unsaturated fatty acid [ 2]. Generally, there are two main types of FAD in plants: ω-6 and ω-3 FADs. Due to their localization, the ω-6 and ω-3 FADs are each classified into microsomal and plastidial groups in plants, respectively [ 15]. The microsomal ω-6 and ω-3 FADs are called FAD2 and FAD3, respectively, while the plastidial ones are called FAD6 and FAD7/8, respectively [ 15, 16]. In the biosynthesis process of FAs, FAD2 catalyzes OA into LA transformations, then LA is catalyzed into ALA by FAD3 in the seeds ( Figure 1). FAD2 has been studied in different species, such as Arabidopsis, soybean, olive, cotton, rape, soybean, flax, sunflower, peanut, and so on [ 9, 17, 18, 19, 20, 21, 22, 23].
